content: the infinitely customizable cable hat recipe created 2013 written oct 2025 yarn used for this image madelinetosh home in maple leaf discontinued since yarn needed any skein of bulky or aran weight you might already have gauge is free and based on length needed for cabled hat band needles 8 to 10 us 16 circular dpns in corresponding size skills needed basic cabling pick up and knit from edge stitches increase/decrease for hat crown trusting your intuition basically i m giving you a recipe for all the hats i ve knit since 2010 a lot this free form hat recipe was created to be based on a construction technique i figured out with a hat i got from forever 21 in the late 00s that hat had pilled so badly but i loved it that it had basically become unwearable so i decided to copy it and reknit it in a better quality yarn that wasn t falling apart your main design element starts from a cabled hat band this could be anything shown above is oxo cable that is knit as a bookmark basically one repeat of any cable pattern you like long enough to cover the circumference of your head around the eyebrows/forehead for me a big beefy corn fed midwestern american that s 22 inches us this part doesn t stretch and is fully customizable so it s important to get that measurement right once you hit your forehead measurement you knit the bottom and top edges of that band together to create a big loop that will grow in both directions crown and earflaps pick up and knit the top edge of that single cable panel and set up for crown stitches and eventual decreasing you can add whatever stitch patterns you like into these decreases it s important to already know an estimate of how many you will need for whatever size you are making baby to adult for adults in a bulky weight yarn you re going to need 60+ live edge stitches and since there is no ribbing in this you might need to adjust with increases as you go up for a basic stockinette stitch topper you can just knit as normal for 2-4 inches and then do decreases in any manner you might be used to i like to use multiples of 8 for my hats but you do you the point is this is flexible decrease until you have under 10 live stitches bind off and sew together leaving a tail to tie on that massive pompom the bigger the better the pompom is the only non negotiable in this entire recipe you can stop here if you want this will leave you with a non-stretchy hat you can easily wear as is or you can add earflaps or ribbing as desired for ribbing you d pick up and knit the bottom edge copying the increases you might ve had to include for the top to get the same amount
